thread.title: Muhammad Ali son detained at a US airport | The Courier-Mail
thread.title_full: Muhammad Ali son detained at a US airport | The Courier-Mail

title: Muhammad Ali son detained at a US airport | The Courier-Mail
text:
Son of legendary boxer Muhammad Ali detained at a US airport, questioned about being a Muslim News Corp Australia Network February 25, 2017 7:28pm 
THE son of legendary boxer Muhammad Ali was reportedly detained by immigration officials at a Florida airport and questioned about being Muslim. Lawyer Chris Mancini has told Louisville’s Courier-Journal 44-year-old Muhammad Ali Jr and his mother Khalilah Camacho-Ali, the second wife of Muhammad Ali, arrived at Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport on February 7 after returning from Jamaica. media_camera Muhammad Ali's second wife Khalilah Camacho-Ali (L) was also held and questioned at the airport. Picture: John Moore/Getty Images Muhammad Ali's Son Detained for Hours at Florida Airport by Immigration: Reports https://t.co/kwmPisJyZP via @people — Jennifer Spengler (@jennyspengler) February 25, 2017 Muhammad Ali's son detained at airport, asked 'Are you Muslim?' https://t.co/Ffn7go287F pic.twitter.com/IeZ4lzU5pk — Yogesh Jaju (@jajuyogeshb) February 25, 2017 Muhammad Ali's Son Detained in Florida Airport Due to Trump's "Extreme Vetting" https://t.co/zfXWlDXocC pic.twitter.com/JNOUebnEed — Shera Koziak (@SheraKoziak) February 25, 2017 Muhammad Ali's son questioned about his faith at airportRory McIlroy questioned about his swing on 9th tee #Trump https://t.co/aDwrX9OIWs — Niall Hawthorne (@NiallHawthorne) February 25, 2017 Boxer @MuhammadAli Ali’s son detained at US airport, questioned about religion. https://t.co/Ykqu5QPacT so this is @realDonaldTrump `s USA pic.twitter.com/apCRgSCAEM 
Mancini says officials questioned Ali Jr for nearly two hours, repeatedly asking him, “Where did you get your name from?” and “Are you Muslim?” Mancini says officials continued questioning Ali Jr after acknowledging he was Muslim. media_camera Muhammad Ali is considered the greatest boxer of all time. Picture: AP/Kathy/Willens 
Ali Jr was born in Philadelphia and holds a US passport. 
US Customs and Border Protection officials say they “cannot discuss individual travellers but all international travellers arriving in the US are subject to CBP inspection”.
